1.16.16.1: Modify the inference file location strategy
1.16.16.2: Add use_amp option for using pytorch amp to accelerate training

1.16.15.1: Fix conversion of apc datasets to atepc datasets

1.16.14.1: Remove dataset version validation in PyABSA module init
1.16.14.2: Remove example validation for ATEPC inference

1.16.13.1: Add empty line check for APC training and dataset conversion

1.16.11.1: Fix a issue which prevents the augmentation dataset loading

1.16.10.1: Try to fix a bug in ATEPC inference related to https://github.com/yangheng95/PyABSA/issues/217

1.16.8.2: Fix a bug in ATEPC dataset conversion

1.16.7.1: Add auto-augmentation (APC & TC) for custom datasets (experimental feature), 1. merge dataset into integrated_datasets (locally or PR), 2. set load_aug=True in trainers, will auto-augment your custom dataset when training

1.16.6.1.1: Improve conversion of apc dataset to atepc dataset

1.16.6.1: Remove the option to read the local checkpoints.json in checkpoint downloading
1.16.6.2: Some prints modifications to the console
1.16.6.5: Will remove Google Drive checkpoints hosting soon

1.16.5.2: Fix offline pretrained model loading for text classification

1.16.4.1: Add validation set support for ATEPC

1.16.2.2: Add probability distribution and confidence to the sentiment classification in ATEPC model
1.16.2.3: Add a experimental feature to automatic annotate the APC amd ATEPC dataset using aspect extractor provided by PyABSA, see demos/aspect_text_extraction/extract_aspect_and_make_dataset.py

1.16.0.1: Fix a checkpoint downloading and inflation bug which prevents loading a checkpoint from huggingface spaces
1.16.0.2: Fix a important bug which cause unexpected low performance when performing ATEPC inference for Chinese language (and possibly other non-latin languages)

1.15.7.2: Default to activate use_bert_spc for ATEPC models to improve ATE and APC performance

1.15.6.1: Add classification report (including precision, recall, F1) display after training, set config.show_metric to activate
1.15.6.2: Add offline option to load huggingface model in inference: set get_xxx(offline=True) to auto detect and load local pretrained model

1.14.7.1: Refactor optimizer support, you can use torch optimizer either by a string or an optimizer object from torch.optim
1.14.7.2: Fix checkpoint saving in some scenarios

1.14.4.1: This version contain breaking experimental changes, if you find any bug please roll back and report on Github

1.14.3(2).1: Refactor pre-tokenization before inference for multilingual ATEPC
1.14.3(2).2: Reset default checkpoint host to Huggingface Hub (useful for Chinese users), please test and report if it works
1.14.3(2).3: Other bug fixes and improvement, see source code

1.13.4.3: Add More language support for ATEPC

1.13.3.1: Improve quality of aspect term extraction results

1.10.5.2: Fix inference of baseline APC models
1.10.5.3: Some refactor, run tests and improve stability

1.10.4.1: Fix a bug in dataset detection, which may cause unexpected dataset mis-detection

1.10.3.1: Add V2 for LSA models, note V2 is not the better model for all scenarios

1.10.0.1: Add more IOB tag support, ref: https://github.com/yangheng95/PyABSA/issues/161
1.10.0.2: WARNING: Modify some models, and some checkpoints on Google Drive may be unavailable due to this update

1.9.6.1: Revert a change causing APC inference fault

1.9.4.1: Add LSA support for BERT-SPC models

1.9.1.1: Fix a bug in auto hidden_dim and embed_dim setting

1.9.0.1: Deprecate hidden_dim and embed_dim setting of pretrained models
1.9.0.3: Add huggingface space support for ATEPC inference

1.8.41.1: Fix output order of ATEPC inference
1.8.41.2: Fix process multi-aspect sentence in ATEPC

1.8.40.1: Fix valid set loading in BertBaseline APC training
1.8.40.2: Fix a bug in multi-cuda training of text classification

1.8.39(38).1: Fix the no decay bug in ATEPC training

1.8.37.1: Fix the fine-tuned bert save function in text classification

1.8.36.1: Fix the fine-tuned bert save function
1.8.36.2: Add notification for augment dataset usage

1.8.34(35).1: Refactor the cache strategy to avoid cache loading error

1.8.32.1: This patch fixes the sentiment prediction in ATEPC
1.8.32.2: Fix a training problem in ATEPC

1.8.30.1: This patch fixes the checkpoint downloading problem

1.8.29.1: Migrate googledrivedownloader to gdown, add a hint for Google Drive's large file download restriction

1.8.28.1: This patch fix a problem in GloVe-based text classification

1.8.25.1: Add raw LSA support option for TNet-LF and ASGCN-BERT

1.8.23.1: Fix a problem of dataset loading

1.8.21.1: Activate retry in case of handle network error

1.8.19.1: Fix a problem about show_metric option

1.8.16(17,18).1: Add simple MetricVisualizer (https://github.com/yangheng95/MetricVisualizer) integration. if you dont want to use MetricVisualizer, please set config.show_metric=False

1.8.14.1: Fix text classification inference using pretrained model (GloVe based inference is not affected)
1.8.14.2: Improve stability in using GloVe based model (include APC, TC)

1.8.13.1: Add confidence in text classification output

1.8.12.1: Add GitEE support in integrated dataset downloading

1.8.11.1: Fix version comparison in parsing checkpoints

1.8.1.1: Fix an inference bug for ATEPC

1.8.0.1: Add more pretrained model (i.e., encoder model) for ATEPC task. e.g., microsoft/deberta-v3-base(large), roberta-base(large)

1.6.17.1: Remove some optimizers to support pytorch < 1.10.1

1.6.15.1: Add validation set support for aspect-based sentiment polarity classification
1.6.15.2: Add confidence output for aspect-based sentiment polarity classification

1.6.10.1: Fix a potential problem while training based on checkpoint in multi-cuda environ

1.6.7(8).1: Fix a potential problem while do batch inference after training based on cached dataset

1.6.4.1: Fix a potential problem in generate APC inference set
1.6.4.2: Register a Yelp dataset in PyABSA provided by WeLi9811: https://github.com/WeiLi9811

1.6.3.1: Fix a potential problem in the sentiment classifier while loading tokenizer
1.6.3.2: Fix a problem in preprocessing in APC inference

1.6.0: This is a stable version which eliminates almost all unknown problems before
1.6.1: Fix a problem in saving fine-tuned pretrained model
1.6.2: Fix an inference problem in LCA-BERT, SSW-T, SSW-S models
1.6.3: Fix a problem in updating ABSADatasets version
1.6.4: Modify the output format for BERTBaseline models and GloVe based models to adapt apc_trainer architecture
1.6.5: Fix the data preprocessing code for BERTBaseline models and GloVe based models
1.6.6: Rename the dependency matrix cache folder, that is for remove conflict between dependency matrix folder and integrated datasets
1.6.7: Add alert while loading fine-tuned models
1.6.8: Fix the inference for DLCF-DCA and DLCFS-DCA models
1.6.9: Fix the embedding function in IAN-Bert model
1.6.10: Fix the hop arg missing problem in Memnet-Bert, Ram-Bert, Memnet-GloVe, Ram-GloVe models
1.6.11: Fix a printing problem in baseline APC model inference result
1.6.12: Fix a parallel problem in BERT-BASE-ATEPC model
1.6.14: Fix test_loader init problem and dataset cache problem in ClassificationTrainer

1.5.4.1: Fix a a bug while using custom dataset

1.5.1: Release after full test, no known error yet
1.5.7: Optimize early stop strategy, now patience means patience for epochs
1.5.8: Fix a problem may fail APC checkpoint loading
1.5.9: Fix a data loading problem for ATEPC
1.5.10: Add cache dataset option for all models

1.3.15.1: Improve stability while using other pretrained models for ATEPC
1.3.15.2: This is a general update of default config for ATEPC

1.3.13.1: Fix a checkpoint loading problem of APC (Some checkpoint at Google Drive may be unavailable now, we will update soon)

1.3.12.1: Refactor to support customize IOB label for ATEPC (The integrated function to covert APC dataset to ATEPC dataset remains only support ASP IOB now, please customize your dataset's IOB label using your own script)
1.3.12.2: Update default pretrained model for ATEPC

1.3.11.1: Divide LSA into FAST-LSA and LSA models

1.3.9.1: Fix low performance of APC using roberta-base

1.3.8.1: Fix a fatal problem in ATEPC example preprocessing (influenced versions: V1.X - V1.3.5), which triggers tremendous ASPECT TOO LONG WARNING. This error severely damaged the ATEPC performance. The ATEPC checkpoints on GoogleDrive were also influenced and may be updated in teh future.
1.3.8.2: Add deep_ensemble option, use config.deep_ensemble=True to activate
1.3.8.3: Add early stop option, default patience=5
1.3.8.4: Refactor utils to print sorted args
1.3.8.5: Fix a problem while using checkpoint_save_mode=3 to save finetuned BERT
1.3.8.6: Refactor to retry training only while catching ConnectionError
1.3.8.7: Fix an ensemble problem in APC
1.3.8.9: Add distributed training option i.e., DataParallel or DistributedDataParallel
1.3.8.10: Fix some potential problem in using other pretrained models in ATEPC to infer (caused by hard code [CLS], [SEP]), support roberta now
1.3.8.11: This is an public test version, could be removed later. Please roll back if you find any problem. I am sorry for my mistake, but I dont have enough time to maintain this project.

1.3.5.2: Add cache dataset option for APC task, use config.cache_dataset=True to activate

1.3.4.1: Replace remaining BertModel.from_pretrained() and BertTokenizer.from_pretrained() with AutoModel.from_pretrained() and AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained()

1.3.1.1: Add multi-cuda support for APC model and part of ATEPC models
1.3.1.2: Add ensemble support for APC models
1.3.1.3: Fix support of legacy APC models in loading & inference using shared checkpoint

1.2.10.1: Add an rule on APC dataset lines checking
1.2.10.2: Add SpaCy model config in classic APC models
1.2.10.3: Not fully tested for all situations

1.2.9.1: Add an rule on APC dataset lines checking
1.2.9.2: You can use multiple types of label in your dataset, e.g., string, number

1.2.8.2: Fix the error to load a inference model from training, i.e., use trainer.load_trained_model() to load the inference model
1.2.8.3: Fix a bug of batch size setting in atepc inference
1.2.8.4: Fix a bug of auto label-mapping

1.2.4.2: Refactor APC inference to merge results with same text

1.2.3.2: Fix some problems in some particular situations

1.2.2.1: Full support of flexible datasets, update ABSADatasets to version 2021.10.02
1.2.2.2: Support batch_size setting in ATEPC, APC, TC inference
1.2.2.3: Fix the inference of DLCF_DCA model

1.2.0.1: Enhance to support more flexible labels, now you can define string-based label instead of integer labels
1.2.0.2: Remove set_sentiment_map() support due to above modification
1.2.0.3: Fix a problem may cause problem while building graph for combined datasets
1.2.0.4: Fix a printing problem in ATEPC
1.2.0.5: Fix a bug in inference set loading
1.2.0.7: This version involves considerable modification and may contain potential bug

1.1.23.1: Improve atepc aspect_extractor result, ensure final output is same length and order as original input examples
1.1.23.2: Fix a problem may merge all aspects of different example into 1 line if duplicate example is fed
1.1.23.3: Fix a problem may cause error in text classification

1.1.22.1: Improve dataset search to be more flexible
1.1.22.2: Refactor label-mapping trigger. This feature is developed based on the mooc dataset: https://github.com/jmc-123/ABSADatasets/tree/master/datasets/apc_datasets/Chinese/mooc
1.1.22.3: Fix the batch inference of text classification
1.1.22.4: Fix the text classification dataset downloading problem
1.1.22.5: Fix a problem may cause failure of ATEPC inference
1.1.22.6: Add the dependency declaration of typing_extensions

1.1.19.1: Fix training without testset in APC
1.1.19.2: Add SpaCy model setting option, e.g., config.spacy_model = 'zh_core_web_sm'

1.1.18.1: Reformat and fix a bug of ATEPC output

1.1.17.1: Add a new Chinese shampoo dataset, thanks to brightgems@github
1.1.17.4: Fix the training and inferring LCA-Net model

1.1.16.1: Enable flexible dataset format for ATEPC dataset, see https://github.com/yangheng95/PyABSA/issues/78
1.1.16.2: Fix a bug may cause checkpoint loading problem on no-cuda device

1.1.13.2: Add batch inference for APC and ATEPC, temporarily using freeze batch size

1.1.12.1: Enable downloading shared checkpoint from a google drive url, this is for downloading checkpoint not registered in PyABSA
1.1.12.3: Add LCF-BERT2 and LCFS-BERT2 demo models

1.1.9.1: Fix a problem in BERT-ATEPC model

1.1.8.1: Fix a problem may cause checkpoint saving failure

1.1.7.1: Fix the inference of ATEPC using internal datasets, if you are using 1.1.5 or 1.1.6, please update to this version
1.1.7.2: Improve stability and test all examples

1.1.3.1: Fix the feature to resume/retrain from a checkpoint

1.0.6.1: Fix potential error loading GloVe-based model's checkpoint.

1.0.5.1: Fix potential error loading ATEPC checkpoint.

1.0.4.1: Add checkpoint save options, default to save the state_dict instead the whole model

0.9.2.0.1: Add text classification (training & inference) support and SST datasets

0.9.1.0.1: Add model type check before retraining
0.9.1.0.2: Fix syntax distance measure for ATEPC models

0.9.0.6.4: Fix a problem may causing failure while search inference datasets

0.9.0.0.1: Add BERT baseline models, not available until full test
0.9.0.0.2: Refactor some code to allow add model easier
0.9.0.0.3: Add post-training feature: to train based on a pretrained PyABSA model, refer to https://github.com/yangheng95/PyABSA/issues/48
0.9.0.0.4: Add batch inference (from file) for ATEPC
0.9.0.0.5: Fix a bug while predicting sentiment polarity using ATEPC model, refer to https://github.com/yangheng95/PyABSA/issues/47

0.8.9.4.1: Fix the inference of DLCF_DCA model

0.8.9.3rc1.1: Add evaluation for glove-based APC models

0.8.9.2.1: Refactor parameter loading method to manage parameters depend on specific model (Note you need to clone the latest examples after updating)
0.8.9.2.3: Plan to enable BERT for baseline models

0.8.9.1.1: Add GloVe models support for APC, available model list: AOA, ASGCN, ATAE-LSTM, Cabasc, IAN, LSTM, MemNet, MGAN, RAM, TC/TD-LSTM, TNet_LF
0.8.9.1.3: Next Step: Add inference support for GloVe-based APC models

0.8.8.8.2: Add release note with open source code

0.8.8.5.1: Add new datasets (T-shirt, Television, Copyright belongs to https://github.com/rajdeep345/ABSA-Reproducibility)
0.8.8.5.2: Add polarity label-fix features for some datasets containing negative labels
